articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
Education and Career Interests
I was born and raised in San Angelo, Texas. I graduated summa cum laude from Texas Tech University in 2021 with a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology. I grew up with a love of nature and a fascination with living things. During my time as an undergraduate, I was involved with research projects including analyzing acoustic data from bats in Southeast Asia, collecting and cataloging insects from around Lubbock, Texas, and studying environmental plant DNA. In my senior year I helped TA for an introductory biology lab and volunteered to co-teach a high school course on energy and sustainability. I also had the opportunity to study abroad in the Turks and Caicos Islands, where my passion for marine conservation blossomed through field classes in tropical marine ecology and marine resource management. Seeing how the local coral reefs and mangrove forests were so important to the community yet also so vulnerable to threats like climate change and overfishing inspired me to strive towards a career in environmental protection. By enrolling at Bren and pursuing a specialization in Coastal Marine Resource Management, I hope to gain the skills necessary to preserve marine ecosystems for the benefit of coastal communities and global biodiversity.
Hobbies

In my free time, I enjoy many outdoor activities including hiking, scuba diving, and mountain biking. I love exploring the Santa Barbara area along with my partner in crime, Willow.

              Kort Alexander
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        LinkedIn
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I am a marine conservationist and graduate of the Bren
            School at UC Santa Barbara with a master’s degree in
            Environmental Science and Management, including a
            specialization in Coastal Marine Resources Management. I am
            currently working as a Waterfront/Research Assistant at the
            School for Field Studies’ Center for Marine Resource Studies
            in the Turks and Caicos Islands, where I help teach marine
            science and scuba diving to undergraduate study abroad
            students, conduct marine research projects, and assist with
            implementation of a coral restoration project. I am
            passionate about protecting and restoring marine ecosystems
            worldwide for the benefit of communities that rely on them.
            I have extensive experience in scientific data management
            and analysis (including spatial data), science communication
            (including writing, social media, and film-making),
            education, and marine research techniques.
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Kort Alexander

              I am a marine conservationist and graduate of the Bren
              School at UC Santa Barbara with a master’s degree in
              Environmental Science and Management, including a
              specialization in Coastal Marine Resources Management. I
              am currently working as a Waterfront/Research Assistant at
              the School for Field Studies’ Center for Marine Resource
              Studies in the Turks and Caicos Islands, where I help
              teach marine science and scuba diving to undergraduate
              study abroad students, conduct marine research projects,
              and assist with implementation of a coral restoration
              project. I am passionate about protecting and restoring
              marine ecosystems worldwide for the benefit of communities
              that rely on them. I have extensive experience in
              scientific data management and analysis (including spatial
              data), science communication (including writing, social
              media, and film-making), education, and marine research
              techniques.

            Tobi Burns
          
          
            
              I am a classically trained data scientist living in the
              San Francisco Bay Area. Currently I work on the Oculus
              team at Facebook. I love talking about baseball, true
              crime podcasts, and causal inference.
